channel.title: Testscape not working = giving rep for help=
channel.description:
ok i have the latest java and i have set the independant variables but still wont work
note: i have now compiled succecfully i just need to find how to get it running i click run and it doesnt work it just flickers on then flickers off.
note: i also have both fully updated versions of java - jdk - jre-
if anyone can help me in anyway to get this up and running i will be over the moon

item.title: Testscape not working = giving rep for help=
item.dc:creator: @jamesmunnelly jamesmunnelly
item.description:
@jamesmunnelly wrote:

No Offence but you are all a bit thick lol

Ok then here it goes.

Right click on compile.bat and click edit
Replace everything in it with this:

@echo off COLOR 03 title Compile Server "C:\Program Files\Java\jdk1.5.0_09\bin\javac.exe" -cp . *.java pause

Note: Replace

C:\Program Files\Java\jdk1.5.0_09\bin\javac.exe

With the path to your javac.exe (must be the javac in Development kit NOT runtime enviroment!)

Save that

Now open up runserver.bat and replace it all with the following:

@echo off color 0a title Server java -Xmx512m -cp .;./jython.jar;./MySql/mysql-connector-java-3.0.17-ga-bin.jar server

Save, Compile and Run!

James,

Read full topic
item.source: Testscape not working = giving rep for help=

item.title: Testscape not working = giving rep for help=
item.dc:creator: @apeskape apeskape
item.description:
@apeskape wrote:

lol u still didnt read my post :o ok listen go to your system variables and make one called CLASSPATH for the value enter CLASSPATH=C:\Program Files\Java\jdk1.5.0_09\bin;%CLASSPATH%;. ok now make one named Path and for the value put in C:\Program Files\Java\jdk1.5.0_09\bin;C:\Program Files\cvsnt that Should work. if it doesnt uninstall your jdk and jre and redownload them because you downloaded some old crap lol

Read full topic

title crazyscape Server

@pause

And my compile which works now is…

@echo off
title swish Compiler
“C:Program FilesJavajdk1.5.0_09injavac.exe” -cp . *.java
“C:Program FilesJavajre1.5.0_09in/java.exe” server
pause[br][size=1]Posted at: November 08, 2006, 01:23:20 PM[/size][hr]cmon people help really needed

item.source: Testscape not working = giving rep for help=

item.title: Testscape not working = giving rep for help=
item.dc:creator: @bryanc Bryanc
item.description:
@bryanc wrote:

apeskape:

did you set the environmental variables?? this was my problem even though i had them installed, it said java/javac was not an internal or external command. go to start->rightlick on my computer->properties->advanced tab. then click environment variables. in the system variables box u gotta click new. create one named CLASSPATHfor the variable name and then enter the directory for your environmental value which is the binfolder in your java folder which is usually like c:\program_files\java\j2sdk\bin or whatever. yours will probly be different. Then do the same exact thing in the same system variables except create one named Path and make this lead to your Bin folder of your sdk. This should fix your problem. enjoy

This is pretty well made but instead of c:\program_files\java\j2sdk\bin put this:
SET CLASSPATH=C:/program files\java\jdk1.5.0_09\bin;%CLASSPATH%;.

Read full topic
